department.dept_long_name: Committee on Concentration in Environmental Science and Public Policy

course.title: China's Energy Economy: Perspectives from the Past: Challenges for the Future
course.faculty_text: Michael B. McElroy and Xi Lu
course.description: The seminar will provide a historical perspective on the development of the Chinese economy with emphasis on the energy sector, including analysis of related environmental problems. Energy options available for China's future will be discussed, including opportunities for clean-coal technology, nuclear, wind, hydro, and biofuels. The seminar will discuss tradeoffs implicit in these choices with respect to reconciling competing goals for environmental protection and economic development.
